Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, in a good location ,just the job .”
Reviews.Author: MBLonUk
Reviews.Content: Having done a lot of research I choose this hotel for a 4 day trip. It was perfect .The room was bigger than many 3 star hotels and clean . Plenty of restaurants nearby and good places to have cafe & croissants . No room safe but that was not an issue. Would definitely go back. Staff were very nice and helpful . Could not believe this was a 2star. Recommend it .

Reviews.Title: “Extremely unpleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: Boston_Traveller_12
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in this hotel while on a business trip. Mr Hossini was working at the front desk. He was hostile from the very first moment. For example, he assigned me a room on the second floor (directly above the restaurant with the outdoor dinner seating) and when I kindly asked if he had a room on the higher floor he proceeded to yell and shout at me. He was saying that if I want a better room I need to come first thing in the morning (?) . This was not explained in a reasonable manner but in a shouting, aggressive, hostile way which was supposed to make feel like an idiot for even asking but in reality made me want to walk right out of the hotel. If this was not a business trip and my colleagues were not staying here I would have done exactly that. I came to the reception 10 min later to see if there was a print out for me and saw him just check in another person with the room on the 6 th floor. When I confronted Mr Hossini and and asked if it was true that the hotel was not full and that he just did not want to give me another room he said ' that's right'. He felt compelled to add that he did not like me from the moment that I walked in. If you decide to stay in this hotel, make sure to be on the 'I like you' list for Mr Hossini or you will be fed up with the stay before you even see your room. I will certainly not go back here.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, nice hotel next to the metro”
Reviews.Author: Marsi_pl
Reviews.Content: - rooms are very clean, modern, quite small (like most of the hotels in Paris), bathroom- clean and modern, - there is a metro next to the hotel, it takes about 20min to get to the eiffel tower or notre dame, - the surroundings of the hotel is very pleasant, there are some outdoor restaurants next to the hotel, and also a nice patisserie

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for the Porte de Versailles Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: Le_Scribe
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in mid January for a Trade Show at the Porte de Versailles Convention Center. For me this was the perfect location. Whilst the Convention Metro stop is just a few steps from the front door of the hotel, I liked to walk the one stop down the streets to the Convention Center. Otherwise, lets face it, the only bits of Paris you get to see is a bar, the hotel room and the Trade Show. It's about a 10 minute walk and very pleasant it was too. A number of reviewers have stated that their bedroom was tiny. It's not. Yes, the rooms are small. This is Paris. I've stayed much smaller bedrooms and vividly remember kicking my toe on the bed at one place it was so small. This in comparison was quite roomy. I didn't eat the breakfast so I can't comment on that. I did grab something from a nearby cafe on both mornings and wandered down to Porte de Versailles enjoying the architecture and munching on a pastry. - The free WiFi was simple to log onto, fast and it worked. - The staff were helpful. - The room was spotless and cleaned to high standards. - The shower was challenging and sprayed in all sorts of directions but it worked. - Contemporary decor. - Reasonably priced for Paris. - Safe area. I walked back to the hotel on the first night after midnight from Porte de Versailles. I have put this hotel into my list of places to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: dayrontbs12001
Reviews.Content: Excelent location. It is a feew steps from the Convention Metro stop. In the neighborhood there are many restaurants, I personally liked very much one that is right across the street(unfortunately I do not remember the name) and the bakery left in the street corner to the right when you leave the hotel. Charming room, clean and comfortable. Free wifi! Safe area...

Reviews.Title: “cute hotel, little rooms”
Reviews.Author: maxinesmom
Reviews.Content: For the price it was a nice little hotel, though I am not sure I would go back. Pros: Cute, charming room; clean, well kept and comfortable. The shower had good water pressure and hot water, the cold water tasted good. Free wifi. The hotel was steps from the metro, and cute neighborhood cafes and bakeries right there. And the market was on many days a great to sample pates, cheese and wine! Cons: The charming room was tiny, very tiny. The bathroom was tiny too. The bathroom door squeaked (and was at my husbands head when he slept, I feared I would wake him when I needed it in the middle of the night). I found the staff very unhelpful and at times rude. I did not know how to sign on to the internet. One man said you are already in as soon as you go on, while another knew nothing. He could also not help get on the computer in the lobby. I eventually figured out that I had to join a free French network to get on. They were equally unhelpful with the phone, not letting me use the lobby one to confirm a reservation or giving me directions on the room phone. After pressing random buttons I got through with the third button whatever that was. But the reason I would probably not stay again was the location. It was just too far from everything. We could not go back in the middle of the day to take a nap, and although a fine neighborhood there was really nothing to see locally. Otherwise, it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: travelinmom64
Reviews.Content: The location of this place is quite good. It is a few feet from the Convention Metro stop. Right outside the door are 3 bistro type cafes with good outdoor seating. There is also a popular bakery within a few steps. There is a street market set up on Sunday mornings directly out front. If you are planning to take in a cooking course at the Cordon Bleu this hotel is just a few minutes walk away. The hotel has been remodeled somewhat recently. It has nice decor except for the carpeting on the steps is a bit obnoxious.

Reviews.Title: “Great location next to metro”
Reviews.Author: lucyluelue
Reviews.Content: Great location next to underground. Small rooms, very clean, very helpful staff. Nice bakery on the corner. Felt safe.

Reviews.Title: “Does the trick!”
Reviews.Author: Ydde21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights and enjoyed our stay. This was not so much due to the hotel as we spent very little time there but the location it was in. Literally 30 seconds from the metro which you can ride to all the major sites, and also a great french bakery 2 doors down and an abundance of restaurants around. The hotel itself was average, with deceivingly small rooms in comparison to the photos online. We can't really comment about the staff because in the time we checked in, to the time we left, all we heard from them was bonjour every morning, no welcome when we arrived or offer for help if we needed it. Our only complaints are that on our second day we got given dirty towels and on our final night a thunder storm struck and our windows kept blowing open as they wouldn't shut properly. This also was a slight annoyance at night, considering the hotel is on a busy road you can hear every vehicle going past.

Reviews.Title: “SImple but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Melbourne001
Reviews.Content: My stay at this hotel was for a business trip. Hotel Convention Montparnasse was adequate for my needs. The room was small, but typical of a Paris hotel. For one person, it was adequate. The bathroom was recently renovated and contained all the functionality you expect of a 2 star hotel. The service was lacking when it came to requesting the use of a printer. For those who would require business needs, this is probably not the right hotel for you. However, the wifi in the room is handy and was fast enough. The draw card for this hotel is its location close to the Convention metro stop. This allows better value for money for a hotel room as well as the convenience of hopping on the metro and easily exploring the amazing city of Paris. I would consider staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, affordable, well located”
Reviews.Author: Boid19
Reviews.Content: We were at the hotel for nine nights and really enjoyed our stay. Convention is a two-star hotel, so don't expect a lot of amenities or spacious rooms. Ours was quite small but very clean througout our stay. Breakfast was a little expensive (9 euros) but it does fill your stomach. The main reason you want to stay there is its location. You step out of the hotel and you have to sidewalk cafés in front of you. Two more are within two hundred feet and the subway station is right next door, literally. The street is lined with neighborhood stores that will get you pretty much everthing you need, from wine to medecines. The subway station is also well located, as it will take you to all major attractions in less than a half hour at the most. There are also quite a few good restaurants within walking distance. Use Lafourchette.com to make your dining reservations. You'll find great dealsl. Daniel from Montreal

Reviews.Title: “An absolute gem! Totally underated”
Reviews.Author: Sodenol
Reviews.Content: The success of this Hotel is greatly restricted by the size of the building itself (hence the low star-rating), but don't let this put you off! Although it may look small from the outside, the rooms themselves are a pleasant surprise. Everything from the modern Boutique furnishings to the friendly (English-speaking) staff and spotless rooms, made this Hotel the perfect stay at an unbeatable price! Other features: - Located in a nice neighbourhood with plenty of patisseries, restaurants, cafe's and supermarkets along each street. - Less than a minute's walk from the nearest Metro Station (Convention) Small words of advice: If you are a bit of tea-belly then you might want to pack a portable kettle, as this is the only thing that I found to be missing in the rooms. All in all, I would recommend this Hotel to anyone wether it be a romantic weekend away or a short family holiday. Will be staying here again if ever we're in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: hdj70
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is situated right next to the Convention Metro stop on line 12 of the Metro. It is a bit far from the main attractions, about 2-3 miles, but if you don't mind walking then it's fine. The walls are very thin and if you are a light sleeper, it will be difficult for you to get a good nights sleep. I was in a room facing the street so the noise from the road and restaurants was very easy to hear all night. If I stay there again I will ask for a room in the back of the hotel. The staff is very friendly and helpful and so are all the people in the area. I would suggest trying to speak a bit of French when you approach someone, it will go a long way with them. This area is great with restaurants and shops nearby and less of a tourist area than most. I would stay here again but will probably spend the extra money and stay a bit closer to all the attractions next time. This hotel is in the 15th district toward the southwest end of that neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem!! will be back!!”
Reviews.Author: MOOMOO7_11
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were going on our first holiday to Paris... We randomly came across this hotel on a website. We got it for a very reasonable price.... very cheap!! We did not get the breakfast. We flew into CDG and from there made our way to the hotel by the underground. It was very easy to get to but took about an hour and 15 mins. The Metro stop is literally 2 secs away as the stop is basically outside the hotel door. Which is so good as you are linked with all of paris. There is restaurants right outside the door and there is also a KFC and Mc Donalds just down the street. There is also a bakery where the metro stop is. We got our breakfast in there each morning. The room is small but this is typical for Paris. Its spotless!! no dirt in sight! We were on the top floor so we had a balcony with a little table and chairs so we could enjoy the view at night. the bathroom is also small but again this is normal for paris. There was hot water all the time and it was also kept very clean! :) The staff at the front desk were also friendly and there english was excellent . However, one of the mornings one of the house keeping staff had trouble trying to understand us but we didnt mind! I will Definitely be back to this hotel as it suited our needs to a T. I would highly recommend it! :D

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean at a nice location”
Reviews.Author: Elisabeth1985
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel while attending a conference at Port de Versailles. It is relatively close to the conference centre (1 metro stop, 10 min walk) but located at a nicer place than other nearby hotels (close to the subway, with bars and restaurants next door). The room was small (if would have been with someone else I would get a bit claustrophobic;) but I had everything I needed and it was really clean. The only thing that annoyed me was that the (free) wifi didn't work and not all staff members were equally helpful or truthful (not believing my key card didn't work but saying it was my fault, telling me there was no curfew but still I should be in by a certain time while in fact I didn't have to, etc). I didn't take breakfast there so I cannot say anything about that.

Reviews.Title: “Small but convinient location”
Reviews.Author: IGS0013
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel from 02/06/11 -04/06/11 for 2 nights while visting with my mother for her 50th birthday. The hotel is small but in a very convinient location with Metro access 1 min walk ( nearest station Convention - green line - no 12)- perfect access to all points of interests max time 15min on the Metro which, by the way is absolutaley filithy in comparison to London. We have stayed in twin room 452 on the 4th floor. Room was good size, basic and newly decorated overviewing the main road. The bathroom and toilet are small but do the job and most of all clean and again newly decorated. The hotel has got free Wi- Fi which is rather unusual for Paris hotel or public places ( including Starbucks - who are charging for internet access)!!! There are plenty of small cafes and restaurants in the area serving variaty of food . Overall great stay in a convinient hotel and great city . Will defo come back

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and contemporary hotel in a busy arrondissement.”
Reviews.Author: mga_law
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms: a triple and a double. The rooms were clean, modestly decorated, equipped with air conditioner, and have large windows. We could have enjoyed more the flat screen TV if there were any show in English, at least, the news channel (Euronews). The triple room was good enough for three people -- not as spacious, but comfortable. We initially stayed at room 606 (triple room), but had to move to another room the following day, because the bathroom sink had a large crack and the room felt creepy. There was free internet, but the computer in the lobby always "had problems with the internet connection." The location of the hotel was very good: the metro station was just a few steps from the hotel, and cafes, groceries, pharmacies, restaurants abound. A nearby boulangerie opens as early as 6:30 a.m. The only thing that I didn't very much appreciate is the busy location: too many vehicles and people traversing the street fronting the hotel anytime of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem at good value for money”
Reviews.Author: shelly_ag
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights in April and were pleasantly surprised by our overall experience. As always, we had booked ourselves in this hotel after going through the reviews on TA and we were not disappointed. The best part about this hotel is its location, right outside the Convention Metro station surrounded by a lovely boulangerie, cafes and a Subway too. We also found the hotel to be safe as the cafes outside are open till late at night. Yes, the rooms are small but this is not uncommon in Paris. The hotel also provides continental breakfast at an additional price of Eur 8 per person but we avoided it as the boulangerie outside was extremely convenient. Positives- 1) Location Location Location ! 2) Tidy and well maintained rooms- the rooms were cleaned appropriately each day 3) Cooperative and well informed staff- they were fluent in English, helpful in advising us on our itinerary, helped us in keeping our luggage on the last day after we checked out and also managed us a booking for Moulin Rouge on the phone 4) Comfortable bed 5) Free Wi-fi which was convenient to use Negatives - Small room, pricey breakfast and a 20 min train ride to the main attractions in Paris. However, that hardly mattered because we were next door to the metro. All in all, a very pleasant and comfortable stay and we would love to go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience tarnished an otherwise positive stay”
Reviews.Author: soul_man19
Reviews.Content: One bad experience tarnished the positives of the hotel experience. The cleaning person that did our room threw away empty mini-travel containers that we had put aside in the bathroom to dry. In addition, we had put aside empty packaging from our shopping trip to one of the boutique stores, and this too was thrown away. The funny thing was, we had genuine rubbish in a plastic bag next to the bedside that was left and not thrown away! We have stayed at many hotels around the world and never had we gone back to our rooms to find stuff that wasn't in the rubbish bins thrown away. We had left receipts and tissues and papers all over the rooms, and unless it was in the rubbish bins, it was left as is. Just a tip, there is no in-room safe. If you want to leave valuables, you have to bring it down to reception and they will put it in an envelope and seal it, then put in their hotel safe. You don't hold a key to it, and in terms of safety, anyone from the hotel staff that have access to the safe can get to your valuables.

Reviews.Title: “a bit small...”
Reviews.Author: Londifornia
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right near the exit to the Convention Metro stop, so very convenient. Many buses to Gare Montparnasse and other locations in central Paris right outside the door. Staff was nice and helpful. Rooms were very clean and nicely laid out. Lovely cafes and cocktails bars JUST outside your door. And evidently a very popular boulangerie just next door. BUT the room was so small it was difficult for the two of us to move about at the same time! And if you are on the first or second floor it's going to be a loud room, real loud, ever night and every morning due to cafe opening and closing. Add general traffic noise and it makes for a difficult night's rest. Recommend 3rd floor or higher. Our shower had 1/2 inch gaps on both sides of the door, so water would get out, but they were clean and recently refurbished. Also, the hotel offers Wifi, but it is difficult to initially sign up and the staff were unable to offer much help with this process.

Reviews.Title: “Indeed only 2 stars”
Reviews.Author: GDRIESSEN
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on a nice square and close to the subway. The neighborhood itself is not very special, although there is a nice movie theater with some English movies. The rooms are very small as is the bed. With my length it was difficult to sleep as the beds were only 1.90m long. The room was very clean though. If the price would be in line with the stars I would have had no problem with the hotel, but given the high price I thought it had a bad/price quality ratio.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for what you pay”
Reviews.Author: bobmel
Reviews.Content: Very convenient to metro but a little far to walk to most sites. Room and bathroom were small and had some quirks, such as one-third glass barrier on shower that was not effective in keeping all the water in and reverse picture on TV. No safe for laptop in room. Beds were comfortable and we liked facing the street in this busy neighborhood. Front desk was great and very helpful. They recommended nearby Restaurant Belasaire which was excellent. We also enjoyed the more casual Le Source right next to the hotel. Breakfast was extra and in basement where the WiFi did not work. Overall a very serviceable hotel at a moderate price that met our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: ljeljelje
Reviews.Content: I used the reviews on Trip Advisor to make my choice. The photos on the hotel website were very accurate. I had never stayed in the Convention area before and was greatly impressed with both the room and the facilities. I chose not to include breakfast as part of my stay as there were restaurants, bakeries, takeaways and a cheap Dia supermarket all within a 1-block radius of the hotel catering to the locals. The traffic is busy during the day, but the room was well soundproofed. The Metro is practically outside the front door, making travelling around the city very convenient. I was greatly impressed by the morning street market on the Sunday and Tuesday I was there. I highly recommend the hotel and the Convention vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “This must be one of Paris' little gems.”
Reviews.Author: DealAlliance
Reviews.Content: Option of staying in hotel room or apartment. Stayed in both which are newly refurbished and very clean. Friendly service. Metro and Market right outside hotel. Our 2 bedroom apartment (no lift) was comfortable, spacious and close to market, shops, cinema. Great way to spend a week in Paris. Definitely will return!

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: vanessa250
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel - conveniently located, well priced, clean, pleasant and with friendly service. A real plus is that if you'd like a little more privacy, you have the choice of staying in an apartment (studio, 1 bed or 2 bed) which has been beautifully refurbished, tastefully decorated and even stocked with milk, yogurts, jam, butter etc. We had a very pleasant stay, excellent value for money

Reviews.Title: “cute and clean hotel, close to main sights”
Reviews.Author: PangeaExplorer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is newly renovated and very clean. The hotel is small and only has about 30 rooms, giving it a quaint, authentic Parisian feel. I stayed here with my girlfriend for 3 nights, and we highly recommend this hotel. The Metro is less than 30 seconds away from the hotel and it only takes about 20min to reach the main tourist sights. The hotel location is also very safe and is close to several cafe's, bakeries and some fast food joints (most of which offer free wifi). For the price, this hotel is hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for an expensive city”
Reviews.Author: toela
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights while visiting Paris for the first time. We had a bit of a time finding the hotel at first, as the "street" , Rue Alain Chartier, is more of a cobblestone walkway, and the street name is attached to the buildings. Once we found it we were very pleased with our room, which was very large, and well appointed. The location right beside the metro made it easy to sight see. The place was very clean and we had a comfortable stay. The bathtub had a hand held shower, but no shower curtain or shower doors? that would be a nice addition, but certainly wasn't a problem. I would recommend this hotel, for quality and value in a very expensive city. If I ever get back to Paris, I would likely try to stay in the St Germain parish neighborhood, as I found it to be more quaint, with cozy restaurants and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value And Quality For Paris”
Reviews.Author: CarlLarson
Reviews.Content: It is very difficult to find a good $100-150/night hotel in Paris. I've stayed in some real disasters. Hotel Convention Montparnasse is a very good hotel for the price and for Paris. It has a great location, right next to the Convention Metro stop. The neighborhood is excellent, not to crowded, with grocery stores and bakeries nearby, and lots of restaurants. The room was clean but typically European small. The bathrooms seemed recently remodeled, but was very small. The hotel was quiet, with only a little noise in the morning as people were waking up. Probably the best hotel I've stayed in while in Paris in this price range, the only one I'd return to. I did have problems with the wifi, which would not except my iPad. Something I experienced at other hotels and cafes on my trips. However my iPod Touch worked fine. But the wifi was down on occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovescotland
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights at the hotel. It is about a 10 minute subway ride for centre of Paris, you come out the subway turn left and the hotel is directly in front of you!! (use the carnet tickets for the subway 10 for 12euro). We didn't arrive till 10pm, check in was quick and hassle free. We were in room 604 overlooking the areas main intersection. The room was double glazed and we heard no street noise at all. As with all Paris hotel rooms it is fairly small. The bed was comfy, the room very clean and it had a modern bathroom. We did not have breakfast in the hotel as there is a bakery next door. There are fruit stall opp the hotel and if you come out and turn right there is a nice, well stocked supermarket up the street. If I had remembered to pack the camera I would have taken photos!!! I would definitely stay at this hotel again and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel with excellent travel links”
Reviews.Author: pbryson14
Reviews.Content: We managed to get this hotel a bit cheaper than normal through AA Getaways and felt that it offered good value for money. The hotel is a 30 second walk away from the metro station which is ideal for getting around the city. The hotel is not in the heart of the city and is towards the edges of the city center, however, the access to the metro being so close means that this is really not an issue. The rooms are not huge, but this is quite normal in European cities. However, the room was more than big enough with a double bed, desk and wardrobe. We went in February and it was very, very cold - the heating in the room worked very well and kept us warm enough. The bathroom was a decent size, with a good shower and was clean. However, the hairdryer did not work, which caused a bit of a problem for my girlfriend as she had not bought her own. We went down for breakfast one morning quite late, but within their advertised time. We were told that they had stopped serving breakfast. When I pointed out to them that we were in the advertised time, they had someone bring some up to our room. The breakfast room is down in the basement and is quite small. The choice is not vast but it is easy enough to find something you want. There are a number of bars/cafes near to the hotel. However, be sure to check the prices before ordering; my girlfriend and I ordered two large beers late one evening and were charged 35euros!!! Not quite what we were expecting, but we just had to laugh it off. We did find Paris very expensive in general, however the current strength of the euro does not help this. Our eurostar return was quite late in the evening, and the hotel kept out cases in a room behind reception for us whilst we went out sight-seeing for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Hotel next to Metro Station”
Reviews.Author: grmartineau
Reviews.Content: Hotel is good value for money - very reasonable price for Paris. First, while not walking distance to most sites (unless you are super in shape), it was conveniently located next to subway station (Convention Station) and gives you easy access to all sites in Paris. Also, 3 banks and ATMs around the corner and a a few restaurants and bistros - even a KFC. The rooms was small - yes... small, but clean and quiet . There is a bistro at street level, but never heard a single noise. Our room also included air conditioning and modern bathroom with shower. Hotel also included breakfast as part of the deal. Good breakfast (croissant, cold meat, eggs, cereals, fruits, coffee, etc.), but be prepared as the breakfast room is very small and gets busy quick. That said, service is excellent. I would recommend to travellers looking for a 2-3 star hotel (not a chain hotel), not scared of taking metro and want a good taste of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Resaco
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 10 days and it ended up providing the perfect home base for our stay. Tourist spots were never more than 15 minutes away by metro, and I can't say enough good things about the neighbourhood. Since my partner and I were looking to avoid overpriced Parisian restaurants, we found the perfect alternative in the neighbourhood's many markets, cheese shops, bread shops, and local cafes. The two supermarkets in the area were also a plus. While the rooms were small by North American standards, we knew to expect this of Paris going in. The bathroom was large and modern, and the bed was comfortable (although one of the pillows was a little lumpy). Rooms were cleaned daily, and no one stole my computer, which I left in the room. The wireless internet, as advertised, was free and functional. Employees were helpful and all spoke English, although some better than others. Breakfast had an extensive selection and was relatively cheap. Overall, a great choice for those looking for an authentic Parisian experience and who don't mind the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a weekend trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: BenyoM
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel for 3 nights. Based on the reviews we were prepared for the small size of the rooms. The room was clean, airconditioned, and with a tiny, but nice bathroom. The hotel receptionist(s) were all kind and helpful. It is a bit distant from CDG Airport (appr.1 hour 15 min by metro and train), but the neighbourhood has its charm. We have not tried the breakfast, but in the cafes you can have a small bite. There are small cafes next to the hotel, bars, bakery on the corner and a small Supermarket nearby. It is not that much touristic area. On Sundays they have a local market, selling meat, vegetables, clothing, etc.. Using the metro (line 12, station Convention) gave us easy access to the city. We used a 6 zone - 3 day metro card, which gave us access to the airport, Versaille at all lines in the city. We would definitely recommend the hotel.. and we also planning to come back here!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: marilusia
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel very much, it was clean, comfortable, very close to the metro station, has many reastaurants nearby, friendly staff and a very good price...

Reviews.Title: “Way Overrated”
Reviews.Author: BourneTraveler
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on positive trip advisor reviews but had a very unpleasant stay. To begin with, the receptionist felt comfortable taking a personal call while my wife, children, and I stood by for 10 minutes waiting to check in, get our room key, and take our luggage up to the room. Once we got to the room we noticed that the white sheets and comforters were not that clean. On the way to the shower my wife cut her foot open on an exposed screw sticking out of the carpet that used to hold some type of door stop. Once inside the bathroom, there was no shower curtain or anything to stop the water from the shower from going all over our bathroom and soaking the entire bathroom floor. The receptionists could care less about these problems. That was our first experience with the hotel. When checking out, things got even worse. My wife and I took a train to the hotel from the airport but decided to take a shuttle back because there was an advertisement for a 16 Euro (per person) shuttle back to the airport. We asked the receptionist to book the shuttle two days before checking out and the day we checked out we asked to confirm the shuttle and, of course, the receptionist never called to make the reservation. The receptionist then called the shuttle service the day we left and assured us that the company was reputable and reliable. The receptionist confirmed that the price would be 32 Euros for my wife and I and that the children were free. After showing up almost 30 min late, the shuttle driver charged my wife and I 60 Euros for the trip once we were at the airport. I told the driver that the receptionist at the hotel confirmed the price of 32 Euros and he said that the hotel was wrong. I can't believe the hotel would recommend and book us a service that ripped us off. So basically all around terrible service at this hotel. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location,clean and comfy.Great service,ideal for a lovely weekend”
Reviews.Author: Maenapiza
Reviews.Content: Great little Hotel in a very well located area just across Pasteur Metro Station (Line 12). Hotel staff extremely friendly and helpful. The room size was basic and clean ( Not huge but not tiny ) with good decorated furnishing.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, comfy and very friendly staff. Ideal for a lovely week-end.”
Reviews.Author: HappyBriton
Reviews.Content: Our room was located on the courtyard, on the 6th floor (with elevator). It was very quiet. The bed were top quality and we had two great nights. The service was excellent, with very friendly staff. The rooms were very comfy and the decoration an adequate mix of modern style. Free wifi access and a computer in the entrance were greatly appreciated. We enjoyed the great location and lively Vaugirard-Convention area (a couple of nice restaurants in the area).

Reviews.Title: “Execellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ballarino
Reviews.Content: Very nice Hotel, great location and great hspitality. Service and confort are excellent. The staff makes you feel at Home. Will definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel - Modern & convenient”
Reviews.Author: Ryders999
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 5 travelling through Europe and we stayed at Hotel Convention in September. The hotel is quite modern and the staff very friendly. The double room was a little cramped (as you would expect in Paris), but the triple room was more spacious. The rooms were very clean and comfortable and being able to open the French windows is definitely a bonus, however you really do appreciate the soundproofing when you close them again. You are spoiled for choice with the cafes and restaurants within walking distance and the metro is literally out the front so it's very convenient to all the sights. We had a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull stay!”
Reviews.Author: Avi62
Reviews.Content: You never know what to expect, but this hotel was beyond expectations. Clean, well furnished, cosy, airconditioned and perfect located. The staff was friendly en helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay: Cute, Clean, Accessible to metro, Great service”
Reviews.Author: Travelingdame
Reviews.Content: * Who says the French are rude? Well, they definitely are NOT rude at this hotel. I loved the hotel clerks whether day or night. They are courteous, warm, and very helpful. * The hotel is really cute and literally five steps away from a metro station. Very convenient. * The rooms are very clean. The beds have crisp white sheets that feel and smell clean. The room is tidied up very nicely. Also, the rooms have a nice modern look in chocolate brown and earth tone colours. *This two-star hotel is more like a three-star and is even better than some supposed 4-star hotels. I recommend this hotel and would probably stay here again when in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “cute hotel..pity about the service”
Reviews.Author: jess1234Dublin
Reviews.Content: PROS - This hotel is super cute and VERY close to the metro. the rooms are small but cozy and decorated nicely. the hotel was clean and there is free internet available in the reception area. I didn't have breakfast included so i'm not sure how this fared. Also the price was pretty good at about 80 euros a night. CONS - The staff were pretty unhelpful and didn't even give us a map when we arrived. Also we needed an iron and they don't have one there! This surprised me as most even basic hotels will have at least one iron and ironing board to share amongst the rooms. The full length mirror was inside a wardrobe and you could only use it by standing on the other side of the bed..which means most of your body is cut off anyway.. Staff also speak very little english, so top up on your french! Overall I liked this hotel a lot but they could make a few little changes to make it even better!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: froggy28
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was very nice. The room was clean and nicely presented The location is great . There is an underground station 50 m away from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bit out of the way, but nice overall”
Reviews.Author: bcvanman
Reviews.Content: We were a bit unsure about this booking because neither of us had been to paris and didn't really know what the expect. The hotel itself was a bit far from the main attractions so it was a little hectic getting there. It was the first stop on our trip and we dragged our luggage on the Metro, having to take several connections just to get to the hotel (in hindsight i would have booked some kind of shuttle just for the stress factor alone). anyway, once we were there and checked in I can say we were pleasantly surprised at how clean and modern the room looked. it was a bit small (as are most hotels rooms in europe), but all we did was sleep there so it worked for what we needed. bed and bathroom were both nice, there was free internet in the lobby, which was always available when we wanted to use it. Cute little cafe next door where we would have breakfast before each day's journey. we stayed 3 nights and became Metro experts by the end because this hotel is so much out of the way of all the main attractions. We pretty much had the entire Metro memorized and i found it fun taking all kinds of different routes to get where we needed to go. however, if you don't like public transit and want to be staying close to the big attractions, this is probably not a good hotel for you. one thing i wasn't pleased with was the staff. The cleaning staff was fine (room was always kept by the time we returned each evening), but the reception staff wasn't very helpful. None of the people we encountered working the desk could speak any english (not that they should have to, but it's nice if you can get one that has english speaking staff). also, the day we were to leave we had an early flight and had to leave the hotel around 4AM. The main entrance is a sliding glass door entrance that is locked at night by the desk clerk. the only way to get in or out is for that clerk to let you in/out. we were on our way out and the clerk was nowhere to be found. took about 15 minutes of playing around with various controls behind the reception desk to find the right switch to open the door. once it was opened the clerk came out all surprised (i think he was sleeping in the back). so just be aware if you're coming or going quite late :)

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: live4kids
Reviews.Content: For 2 adults and 3 kids, i had booked a double room and a triple room. when we checked in, the man in the reception mentioned that he could not give 2 rooms close together as the double rooms are away from triple rooms. I asked for 2 double rooms instead and said will use the existing bed for one child. He did give us 2 double rooms adjacent to each other and when we went upstairs we found that there was another door which can be locked keeping these 2 rooms open. It was ideal for us with kids and we did not expect to get rooms like that. The rooms were clean, bathrooms had new fixtures and very clean. The restaurant downstairs was crowded until about midnight. But once we closed the door to the balcony, it was quite. The metro station is within 50 feet and our stay was very pleasant. Both men at the reception were courteous. He charged us for only 2 double rooms, although we thought he would charge for 1 double and 1 triple as we had booked. The breakfast was good, the lady was nice even though we stayed there little after the breakfast time.
